intro: Schinus odonellii, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a striking visual element to its habitat. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, textured surface. Schinus odonellii is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it adapts well to dry conditions.
